snippet: As unlimited data plans fade away, services and applications are being designed to help users manage their consumption.
abstract: Several companies are introducing mobile phone applications that help users manage and understand their data usage, as cellphone carriers replace unlimited data with more limited plans; apps point out instances of heavy data usage such as video and image sites, helping users tweak their habits to avoid extra charges.

headline.main: Apps Seek to Help Phone Users Track Data
headline.print_headline: Apps Seek To Help Phone Users Track Data

snippet: Jeff Han from Perceptive Pixel visits The New York Times and shows off his multi-touch display.
abstract: Jeff Han from Perceptive Pixel visits The New York Times and shows off his multi-touch display.

headline.main: Jeff Han from Perceptive Pixel visits The New York Times

snippet: iRobot has sold millions of Roomba vacuum cleaners, and its bomb disposal robots protect soldiers. Now, it is using video and computing advances to create robots that can handle more duties.
abstract: iRobot, company that has had considerable success with its Roomba automated vacuum cleaners, is developing a new generation of robots that will be able to handle a wider array of tasks; company is developing a 5-foot-4 model called Ava, which utilizes video and computing advances to do office work remotely, and which may one day handle household chores.

headline.main: For iRobot, the Future Is Getting Closer

snippet: A weird N.H.L. season has Montreal in the dumps despite a prodigy and a strange shootout win.
abstract: A weird N.H.L. season has Montreal in the dumps despite a prodigy and a strange shootout win.

snippet: The New York International Children’s Film Festival offers more than 100 films over four weekends at seven locations for an expected audience of 25,000.
abstract: New York International Children’s Film Festival, approaching its 15th birthday, has a reputation for independence and risk taking; festival offers more than 100 films over four weekends at seven locations for an expected audience of 25,000, and has become a full-fledged part of the film festival circuit.

headline.main: Kids’ Film Festival: Fear, Astonishment and the Beatles
headline.print_headline: Kids’ Film Festival: Fear, Astonishment And the Beatles

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: New York International Children's Film Festival

snippet: 7:17 p.m. | Updated Adding context in fourth paragraph.     It's not just Apple. Photos are vulnerable on Android phones, too.
abstract: Smartphones that run Google's Android system have the capability to secretly copy photos and post them on the Web; by design, Android apps do not need permission to get a user's photos, but it is unclear whether any apps are actually doing this; apps are required to alert users when they want retrieve other kinds of personal data, so the lack of protection for photos comes as a surprise to some experts. Photos (M)h

headline.main: Android Phones Can Secretly Copy Photos and Post Them on Web

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and NICK BILTON
